name: Broccoli Soup
description: Creamy and healthy broccoli soup. Low calorie but satisfying - even kids love it!

instructions.instruction: Wash broccoli. Separate florets from stems. Peel tough outer skin from stems and cube.
instructions.tip: Stems are nutritious too - don't discard!

instructions.instruction: Melt butter with olive oil in large pot over medium heat.
Add onion and sauté 5 minutes until soft.
Add broccoli stems and potato cubes. Sauté 2 minutes.
Add vegetable broth. Bring to boil.
Add broccoli florets. Once boiling, reduce heat.
instructions.tip: Save a few small florets for garnish.

instructions.instruction: Simmer 15-18 minutes until broccoli and potato are soft.
Remove from heat. Blend until smooth with immersion blender.
instructions.tip: Leave slightly chunky if you prefer texture.

instructions.instruction: Add milk and stir. Check consistency - add more broth if too thick.
Return to low heat. Add most of the cheese and stir until melted.
Season with salt, pepper, and nutmeg.
Ladle into bowls. Sprinkle remaining cheese on top. Add reserved broccoli florets.

tips: Broccoli is rich in vitamin C, vitamin K, and fiber.
Potato adds natural thickness - no flour needed.
Use nutritional yeast instead of cheese for vegan version.
Great way to get kids to eat vegetables!
servingSuggestion: Serve with crusty bread or crispy croutons. Drizzle olive oil on top.
variations: Vegan: Use nutritional yeast and coconut milk.
With spinach: Replace half broccoli with spinach.
Spicy: Add red pepper flakes and jalapeño.
